text: Nearchus (, Nearchos) was a tyrant of the ancient Greek city of Elea in Magna Graecia who ruled in the 5th century BC. He is only known from an anecdote in connection with the philosopher Zeno of Elea, whom Nearchus put to the torture for having conspired against his life.Diodorus Siculus X Eacc. Vales, p. 557, Eocc. Vat. p. 36; Valerius Maximus III 3. ext. 3; Diogenes Laërtius IX 29. ==References== Category:Ancient Greek tyrants Category:5th-century BC Greek people Category:Year of birth unknown Category:Lucanian Greeks
title: Nearchus of Elea
